016
017package org.parboiled.examples.calculators;
018
019import org.parboiled.Rule;
020import org.parboiled.annotations.BuildParseTree;
021import org.parboiled.support.Var;
022import org.parboiled.support.Var;
023
024/**
025 * A calculator parser defining the same language as the CalculatorParser3 but using a rule building helper methods
026 * to Factor out common constructs.
027 */
028@BuildParseTree
029public class CalculatorParser4 extends CalculatorParser<CalculatorParser3.CalcNode> {
030
031    @Override
032    public Rule InputLine() {
033        return Sequence(Expression(), EOI);
034    }
035
036    public Rule Expression() {
037        return OperatorRule(Term(), FirstOf("+ ", "- "));
038    }
039
040    public Rule Term() {
041        return OperatorRule(Factor(), FirstOf("* ", "/ "));
042    }
043
044    public Rule Factor() {
045        // by using toRule("^ ") instead of Ch('^') we make use of the fromCharLiteral(...) transformation below
046        return OperatorRule(Atom(), toRule("^ "));
047    }
048
049    public Rule OperatorRule(Rule subRule, Rule operatorRule) {
050        Var<Character> op = new Var<Character>();
051        return Sequence(
052                subRule,
053                ZeroOrMore(
054                        operatorRule, op.set(matchedChar()),
055                        subRule,
056                        push(new CalculatorParser3.CalcNode(op.get(), pop(1), pop()))
057                )
058        );
059    }
060
061    public Rule Atom() {
062        return FirstOf(Number(), SquareRoot(), Parens());
063    }
064
065    public Rule SquareRoot() {
066        return Sequence("SQRT", Parens(), push(new CalculatorParser3.CalcNode('R', pop(), null)));
067    }
068
069    public Rule Parens() {
070        return Sequence("( ", Expression(), ") ");
071    }
072
073    public Rule Number() {
074        return Sequence(
075                Sequence(
076                        Optional(Ch('-')),
077                        OneOrMore(Digit()),
078                        Optional(Ch('.'), OneOrMore(Digit()))
079                ),
080                // the action uses a default string in case it is run during error recovery (resynchronization)
081                push(new CalculatorParser3.CalcNode(Double.parseDouble(matchOrDefault("0")))),
082                WhiteSpace()
083        );
084    }
085
086    public Rule Digit() {
087        return CharRange('0', '9');
088    }
089
090    public Rule WhiteSpace() {
091        return ZeroOrMore(AnyOf(" \t\f"));
092    }
093
094    // we redefine the rule creation for string literals to automatically match trailing whitespace if the string
095    // literal ends with a space character, this way we don't have to insert extra whitespace() rules after each
096    // character or string literal
097    @Override
098    protected Rule fromStringLiteral(String string) {
099        return string.endsWith(" ") ?
100                Sequence(String(string.substring(0, string.length() - 1)), WhiteSpace()) :
101                String(string);
102    }
103
104    //**************** MAIN ****************
105
106    public static void main(String[] args) {
107        main(CalculatorParser4.class);
108    }
109}
